```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, results="asis"}
load("Fitted_rain_model.Rdata")
require(dplyr)
require(xtable)
require(lubridate)
library(knitr)

trans_summary<-spotlight %>%
  mutate(Year=year(Date)) %>%
  group_by(Site) %>%
  summarise(firstsamp=round(min(Year)), 
  		  lastsamp=round(max(Year)), 
  		  total_surv=length(Foxes), 
  		  years_samped=n_distinct(Year), 
  		  maxlength=max(TransectLength)/1000, 
  		  meanlength=round(mean(TransectLength)/1000, 2))

names(trans_summary)<-c("Transect", "First Surv.", "Last Surv.", "Total Survs.", "Years with Survs.", "Length (km)", "Mean length (km)")

#rename "Yarram/Woodside" to just "Yarram"
trans_summary$Transect <-as.character(trans_summary$Transect)
trans_summary$Transect[trans_summary$Transect=="Yarram/Woodside"] <- "Yarram"

kable(trans_summary, caption="Table S1. Summary statistics for the 21 transects surveyed for abundance of foxes and rabbits. Mean length is the mean transect length actually surveyed across all surveys at each transect.",
	align=c("c", "c", "c", "c", "c","c", "c", "c") )

The shaded areas delimit the approximate dates of the south-eastern Australian Millenium Drought of 2001-2009. Sites are arranged in order of increasing monthly mean rainfall.](Figures/rain_graph.pdf)

![Figure S2. Posterior densities for the site-level random effects terms for rates of increase of rabbits.](Figures/raneff_violin.png)

![Figure S3. Posterior predictive check of the state-space model of fox and rabbit abundances. The posterior predictive check is based on $\chi^2$ discrepancy between real and simulated counts of foxes and rabbits and the predicted values of the model. Bayesian p-values are the proportion of simulations where $\chi_{obs}^{2}>\chi_{rep}^{2}$.](Figures/PPcheck.png)
